title: Jack's Poisoning
description: A rude soccer player named Jack dies of poisoning after a team dinner. Jack had eaten some of his teammate Harry's fries, had his other teammate Charlie buy him an energy drink, and ate his teammate Oliver's apple pie. The waiter also served him his meal. However, no poison was found on the fries, the energy drink, the leftover apple pie, or Jack's main meal.
clues: Jack ate Harry's fries.
Charlie bought the energy drink.
Jack ate Oliver's apple pie.
Waiter served the main meal.
No poison was found in any of the food or drink items.
reasoning: Charlie laced the straw of the energy drink with poison, which killed Jack.

title: The Mafia Boss
description: Agent Jason needs to identify a Mafia boss from five suspects: Jeff Norman, Liam Walton, Cain Hunter, Cole Carry, and Nolde Ramsey. From a public phone booth, Jason leaves a coded message for his agency head, David, stating that his cell phone's dialing pad isn't working. The message includes a tracking number: 738684-36254. He also mentions a mirror. After this, Jason loses his memory. The key is hidden in the tracking number and the mirror hint.
clues: Tracking number: 738684-36254.
Mentions of a mirror.
Reference to a phone dialing pad.
reasoning: When the tracking number is mirrored, it becomes 52632-486837. Mapping these numbers to letters on a phone dialing pad spells out 'Cain Hunter'.

title: Desert Murder
description: A film crew in the desert has their bus and all of their equipment stolen. On the fourth day, the director is found murdered in his tent. The scriptwriter was working on the script in his tent. The cameraman was shooting different angles nearby for the last four days. The producer was sick in his tent, and the hero was rehearsing lines with the heroine in his tent.
clues: All equipment was stolen.
Cameraman claims to have been shooting for 4 days.
Hero was rehearsing with Heroine.
Producer claims to be sick.
reasoning: If all the equipment was stolen, the cameraman wouldn't have been able to recharge his camera's battery to continue shooting for four days. His alibi doesn't hold up.

title: Old Man's Murder
description: An old man is found murdered in his cottage by the mailman on a Thursday morning. At the scene, there are two bottles of milk, Monday's newspaper, a catalog, flyers, and unopened mail. The key observation is that Tuesday's and Wednesday's newspapers are missing, which suggests foul play.
clues: Only Monday’s newspaper is present.
Tuesday and Wednesday's newspapers are missing.
Two bottles of milk are outside the door.
reasoning: The missing newspapers suggest the newspaper boy did not deliver them, indicating involvement.

title: Mr. Paul's Poisoning
description: Mr. Paul dies of poisoning after having dinner at Mr. Joe's restaurant. Surveillance video shows Mr. Joe, Mr. Paul, their business manager, their accountant, Mr. Paul's wife Janice, and the waiter at the table. The manager looked worriedly at his watch, the accountant passed food and cut an apple in half—giving one half to Mr. Paul. Mr. Joe was quietly on the phone. Janice kept glancing at the door, whispered to the waiter, and went to the restroom. The waiter served food and replaced Mr. Paul's fork after dropping it.
clues: Accountant cut an apple in half and gave one half to Mr. Paul.
Waiter replaced Mr. Paul's fork after dropping it.
Janice whispered something to the waiter.
reasoning: The accountant used a knife that was coated with poison on one side to slice the apple, poisoning only Mr. Paul's half. Mr. Paul was about to expose the accountant’s fraud.

title: Frosty Window Murder
description: An old man is found dead in his TV lounge. His friend calls the police, claiming he wiped frost off the window from the outside to look inside and saw the body. The police immediately find the friend's statement suspicious.
clues: Frost forms on the inside surface of windows, not outside.
reasoning: The friend lied about wiping frost from the outside, which is impossible.

title: The Hung Woman
description: A woman is found dead, hung from the ceiling in a completely empty room with no windows, chairs, or tables. The only clue is that the carpet is wet and soaked.
clues: No objects in the room except wet carpet.
reasoning: She stood on large ice slats that melted, leaving the carpet wet.

title: The Broken Window
description: A couple reports a robbery, claiming a burglar entered by breaking a window. The policeman states immediately that it wasn’t an outsider.
clues: Glass from the broken window is outside, not inside.
reasoning: If broken from outside, glass shards would be inside.

title: Stuart's Code
description: In a mock case, Stuart is murdered by one of his five friends: Thomas, Claude, Phillip, Mark, or Stuart. Before dying, Stuart scribbles 'O G H K H O' as a clue to the killer's name.
clues: O G H K H O is a code that points to the killer's name.
reasoning: Stuart wrote letters that come one step before each letter in 'Phillip' (P -> O, H -> G, etc.).

title: Cassette Recorder Suicide
description: A man is found dead with a cassette recorder in one hand and a gun in the other. The tape plays a suicide note followed by a gunshot sound. The police instantly know it’s not a suicide.
clues: The tape was rewound for the police to play.
reasoning: A dead man cannot rewind a cassette tape.

title: Hotel Manager Murder
description: Four friends stay overnight at a hotel before a concert. The next morning, the hotel manager is murdered. Their alibis include golf, washing clothes, gym workout, and swimming.
clues: The second friend claims to wash clothes, but they didn’t bring any clothes.
reasoning: They came without luggage, so there was no need to wash clothes.

title: Mr. Smith's Brother Murder
description: Mr. Smith's brother is murdered. The gardener, neighbor, Mr. Smith, and servant all provide alibis.
clues: Servant claims he went to the post office on Sunday.
reasoning: Post offices are closed on Sundays, so the servant is lying.

title: Bank Robbery Call
description: During a bank robbery, manager Peter receives a call from his wife Kathleen asking him to bring home batteries. He cleverly signals the robbery situation to her without alerting the robber.
clues: Peter presses the mute button to convey a hidden message.
reasoning: Peter used mute button intervals to send a hidden SOS message, which Kathleen decoded.
